description: The function 'draw_fraction_addition_model' generates a visual representation of the addition of two fractions. It can display the fractions either stacked vertically or side-by-side horizontally. The function is designed to aid in the understanding of fraction addition by providing a visual model of the process.

educational_standards.description: Add fractions less than one with unlike denominators.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Fraction Addition Models
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'draw_fraction_addition_model' function is capable of generating images that visually represent the addition of two fractions. It accepts inputs in the form of a FractionAdditionModel, which contains two fractions, layout preference (vertical or horizontal), and options to show a plus sign and a divider line. The function is designed to help students understand the concept of fraction addition by providing a visual representation of the process. The generated images can be used in various educational settings, including classroom instruction, homework assignments, and online learning platforms.

details: model_data: FractionAdditionModel - This input contains two fractions, layout preference, and options to show a plus sign and a divider line.
fraction1: Fraction - The first fraction to be added.
fraction2: Fraction - The second fraction to be added.
show_plus_sign: bool - Option to display a plus sign between the fractions.
show_divider_line: bool - Option to display a divider line below the fractions.
The fractions must be valid fractions.
The layout must be either 'vertical' or 'horizontal'.
The show_plus_sign and show_divider_line fields must be boolean values.
The function draws two fraction bars representing the fractions to be added.
If the layout is 'vertical', the fractions are stacked vertically; if 'horizontal', they are displayed side-by-side.
If show_plus_sign is True, a plus sign is displayed between the fractions; if False, no plus sign is displayed.
If show_divider_line is True, a divider line is drawn below the fractions; if False, no divider line is drawn.
